title: Overview
content: Farming is one of the most ironman-friendly skills in RS3 — almost everything is self-sufficient once seeds are flowing. The skill combines herb patches (which feed Herblore), tree runs (passive high XP), and the Player-Owned Farm (POF) for consistent daily XP.

The biggest early challenge is seed acquisition. Focus on unlocking multiple seed sources and establishing a daily farm run habit. Once herb patches and POF are both running, Farming levels come naturally alongside your other skills.

title: Seed Sources
content: Seeds cannot be bought from the Grand Exchange as an ironman. Key sources:
- Master Farmers (level 38 Thieving): best early seed source, yields herb seeds, allotment seeds, and tree seeds per pickpocket.
- Slayer: Aberrant Spectres, Turoth, and Aquanites are top herb seed droppers. Many other monsters drop allotment and flower seeds.
- Managing Miscellania: set workers to Farming for a passive daily supply of seeds.
- Wilderness Flash Events (Surprising Seedlings, Evil Bloodwood Tree): free early Farming XP at levels 1–30.
- Quests: My Arm's Big Adventure (+5,000 XP), Fairytale I (+3,500 XP), Grim Tales (+6,000 XP at level 45).

title: Levels 1–30: Events and Early Patches
content: Seeds are scarce early on. Use free XP sources while establishing your supply.
- Nemi Forest: gathering activities give passive Farming XP.
- Wilderness Flash Events: available from level 1, completely free XP.
- Plant whatever allotment and flower seeds you receive from early Slayer tasks.
Unlock all available herb patches as soon as possible: Falador, Catherby, Ardougne, Canifis, Trollheim (level 29), Morytania, Harmony Island, and the Farming Guild (level 45).

title: Levels 17+: Player-Owned Farm
content: The Player-Owned Farm unlocks at level 17 and is the cornerstone of ironman Farming XP — free daily XP from raising and selling animals.
- Start with the tutorial rabbits. Age them to elder stage (250 XP each) and sell to Myfi.
- Level 28: buy 12 chicken eggs daily from the Farmers' Market, grow to elder, sell to Henrietta (~15,000 XP/day).
- Levels 28, 35, 49: unlock chickens, sheep, and cows. Each pen adds to your daily XP total.
- Level 54+: unlock breeding for all pens. Breed, age to elder, and sell the best animals each day.
- Add woad leaves to all 7 beehives (behind the large pen) for ~14,000 passive XP/day with zero effort.
- Hire farmhand Adam Antite (5,000 beans) as soon as possible to automate animal collection.

title: Mid Levels (30–75): Tree Runs
content: Tree runs are the main source of large Farming XP per day alongside POF. Check-health XP is awarded when a fully grown tree is inspected.
- Regular trees: Oak (15), Willow (25), Maple (45), Yew (60), Magic (75). Plant saplings at tree patches across the game world.
- Fruit trees: Apple (27) through Dragonfruit (81). Each mature fruit tree gives very high check-health XP.
- Het's Oasis bushes: available at levels 30, 50, 70, and 90. Passive XP every few days.
- Farming Guild (level 45): herb, bush, tree, flower, allotment, and cactus patches all in one location — essential for fast farm runs.
Tip: Teleport tablets and the Farm Teleport from the Farming Guild significantly reduce farm run time.

title: High Levels (75–120): Seedicide and Endgame
content: At high levels, Slayer seed income becomes large enough to plant all patches consistently.

- Seedicide (from Cabbage Facepunch Bonanza): destroys seed drops from monsters for double their planted XP. Best used with Morchella mushroom spores and Snape Grass seeds from Turoth, Aquanites, and Vyrewatch.
- Maple seeds: obtainable from Mutated Bloodvelds (level 91). Requires partial completion of Legacy of Seergaze to access.
- Dragonfruit trees (level 81): very high check-health XP. Seeds from Zygomites or Slayer.
- Farming Guild contracts: daily contracts reward bonus XP, herbs, and other farming rewards — always complete these.
